meanings.definition: To leap up or spring up suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The frog will upleap onto the lily pad.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to upleap onto the fence to see the birds.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to upleap onto the bird feeder but missed and fell.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to upleap with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player's upleap for the slam dunk was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: A sudden upward leap or spring.
meanings.sent1: The deer's upleap over the fence was graceful and swift.
meanings.sent2: The kangaroo's powerful upleap surprised the onlookers at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The upleap of the balloon caught everyone's attention at the festival.
meanings.sent4: The upleap of the flames in the campfire lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The upleap of the dolphin from the water was a beautiful sight to behold.
